intro: Austrocephalocereus estevesii, commonly known as the São Paulo cactus, is a species of cactus native to Brazil. It is characterized by its tall, columnar stems that can grow up to several meters in height. The plant produces clusters of white flowers during the summer months, which are followed by small, red fruits. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, with thick, waxy stems that store water. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value and resilience in dry conditions.
